itemDescription: Member of the House of Lords (born 1939)

wikipedia_page.main:
Anthony Fitzhardinge Gueterbock, 18th Baron Berkeley, Baron Gueterbock,  (born 20 September 1939), otherwise known as Tony Berkeley, is a British aristocrat and Labour parliamentarian.
Holder of an ancient English hereditary peerage title created in 1421, Lord Berkeley sits in the House of Lords by virtue of being created a life peer in 2000.

response: *Anthony Gueterbock, 18th Baron Berkeley (born 1939), British aristocrat and parliamentarian

link_mentions.page: List of barons in the peerages of Britain and Ireland

response: *Anthony Gueterbock, 18th Baron Berkeley (Lab), civil engineer and parliamentarian, sold the last family land in the ward and nominated "of Cranford, London" to be his territorial designation of his life peerage.
